simple.escp.dom.line

Class ListLine

  • java.lang.Object
    • simple.escp.dom.Line
      • simple.escp.dom.line.ListLine

  • public class ListLine
extends Line
    DOM class to represent list. A list is something like TableLine but doesn't have columnar layout.

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      ListLine(java.lang.String source, java.lang.String lineSource, TextLine[] header, TextLine[] footer)
      Create a new ListLine.

    • Constructor Detail

      • ListLine

        public ListLine(java.lang.String source,
        java.lang.String lineSource,
        TextLine[] header,
        TextLine[] footer)
        Create a new ListLine.
        Parameters:
        source - a placeholder text to retrieve data source for this list. It should be evaluated to a Collection during filling.
        lineSource - a placeholder text for every line in this list. It will be used to translate every elements in Collection source into a text.
        header - header for this list. Set to null if this list doesn't have header.
        footer - footer for this list. Set to null if this list doesn't have footer.

      • isDynamic

        public boolean isDynamic()
        Description copied from class: Line
        Defines wether this line is a dynamic line or not. A dynamic line is a line that will be expanded later when filling this line with data. For example, a table line is a dynamic line because number of lines for that table can't be defined in parsing step. It requires the actual value to define the actual number of lines.
        Specified by:
        isDynamic in class Line
        Returns:
        true if this is a dynamic line or false if otherwise.
